Here at a sacred place on Memorial Day Weekend, the Maine Veterans’ Memorial Cemetery in Augusta, to honor the sacrifice that our veterans have made for Maine and their country. pic.twitter.com/MAot898q4v

Our world is more connected than ever – creating both new opportunities and vulnerabilities. These calls are more than just an annoying – often, these are scammers attempting to take advantage of our most vulnerable citizens, particularly seniors. Glad the Senate is taking steps to hang up on these scams once and for all.

Great news for all who are targeted by illegal robocalls – last week, the Senate passed the TRACED Act, a bipartisan bill I cosponsored that cracks down on these scams. Read more about the bill: https://wgme.com/news/local/sen-angus-king-announces-bill-to-help-stop-robocalls …

Each year, the NDAA sets an example of how governing should work: Congress putting aside partisanship to provide for our common defense. The bill prioritizes cybersecurity, invests in R&D, and takes care of our servicemembers – it’s a good bill, and one I’m proud to support.

Yesterday, the Senate Armed Services Committee passed the National Defense Authorization Act with a number of provisions that reinforce Maine’s role in defending our nation – including funds for shipbuilding at @GDBIW. Read more here:  https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/in-defense-bill-king-addresses-maine-and-national-priorities …

Maine’s forest economy is growing in a positive direction – we’re producing extraordinary bio-based products right here in Maine, and helping our businesses expand their reach to international markets. Great morning at the @MEIntlTradeCtr #TradeDay2019! https://twitter.com/MEIntlTradeCtr/status/1131920681967525889 …

Cyber-attacks are among the most serious threats we face, but we don't have a strategy prepared to take on a challenge of this magnitude. At ~12:30, I’ll join @mitchellreports to discuss the @CyberSolarium’s work to address cyber threats and the ongoing situation in Iran. Tune in!

In the 21st century, our lives are more connected than ever – bringing both new benefits and new threats. Gold Star Families have made profound sacrifices for our nation – they deserve our respect, gratitude, and support as they grieve. Grateful that the Senate unanimously passed a bill I cosponsored to undo a new financial hardship created by the tax bill. https://thehill.com/policy/finance/444764-senate-passes-bill-to-undo-tax-increase-on-gold-star-families …

These parks are so important to so many Americans – and yet, the @NatlParkService is facing a $12 billion backlog. That’s why I’m leading the bipartisan Restore Our Parks Act to protect these lands for future generations. Read more: https://www.penbaypilot.com/article/sen-angus-king-pushes-bill-restore-national-parks/111831 …

Our national parks are a uniquely American treasure that reflect our country’s limitless natural potential, diversity of experience, and commitment to pass on a better world to our children. I’m honored to fight for them so future Americans can share the same experience.

America’s national parks hold a special place in my heart. I’m honored that I get to fight for these lands every day as Ranking Member of the Senate’s National Parks Subcommittee, and this morning I was honored to receive the 2019 National Park Heritage Award from the @NPCA. pic.twitter.com/rTD06KoxzK

I’ve been making this point again and again, to anyone who will listen: Maine people are hurting. They shouldn’t be collateral damage in an international trade war – we should allow them to continue to do their jobs, and sell their superior product around the globe.

Maine’s lobster industry is poised for massive growth – but as this piece from @NewDay’s @MiguelMarquez illustrates, the ongoing uncertainty of the trade war is holding it back. That means less money into Maine, and fewer good jobs on the coast of Maine. pic.twitter.com/ktUw8oseXT

Elections are the foundation of our democracy, and must be protected from 21st century threats. That's why I'm supporting legislation to have paper ballots as backups and to keep the process offline, away from cybervulnerabilities.  https://www.king.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/king-colleagues-push-legislation-to-shield-american-elections-from-threats …

We don’t own this planet – we have it on loan from our children. In order to be good stewards, we have to follow the Maine Rototiller Rule: when you borrow something, give it back in as good shape as you got it. But right now, we’re failing that test for our national parks. pic.twitter.com/twuXx88DSD

This weekend, it was 84 degrees on the Arctic coast. 

For the first time in human history, the amount of CO2 in the atmosphere exceeded 415 parts per million. 

The science is staring us in the face here. We need to take note, and take action – now. https://www.washingtonpost.com/weather/2019/05/14/it-was-degrees-near-arctic-ocean-this-weekend-carbon-dioxide-hit-its-highest-level-human-history/?utm_term=.5bb12d6ebb90 …

Rob started @AllagashBrewing in 1995 with one kind of beer and one employee: himself. Today, the company has released dozens of new beers and counts a total of 132 employees. A great success story for #SmallBusinessWeek – congrats Rob and team!

Maine's Rob Tod, the founder of @AllagashBrewing, was named the top professional in the Outstanding Wine, Beer or Spirit Producer category by the nationally-renowned @beardfoundation! https://www.pressherald.com/2019/05/06/rob-tod-founder-of-allagash-brewing-win-a-james-beard-award/ …

The Cyberspace Solarium Commission will build a foundation to defend our nation from ongoing attacks and prevent attacks by adversaries who are considering launching future assaults on our digital infrastructure. I’m ready to get to work on this vital issue.

With each passing moment of inaction, the risk of an attack upon critical infrastructure such as our electric grid or communications networks grows graver. So much of our daily lives rely on digital infrastructure – we owe it to the American people to face this challenge head on.

Our increasingly digital existence brings both new opportunities and new threats. We’re not yet prepared to confront the dangers posed by cyber-attacks, which is why I’m joining with @RepGallagher to lead the @CyberSolarium. https://thehill.com/policy/cybersecurity/442720-sen-king-rep-gallagher-to-chair-bipartisan-commission-with-mission-to …

This is an important step in the fight to provide real relief for American people struggling with the costs of prescription drugs, and I will continue pushing the Administration and my colleagues in Congress to enact additional changes to build on this important work.

This new rule, which mirrors a bill I've championed for years and has significant bipartisan support, will bring much-needed accountability and transparency to prescription drug costs, so patients can fully understand what they’re being sold.

For decades, pharmaceutical companies have been able to advertise their drugs to the public without disclosing their prices, and all the while, those prices have continued to rise. No more. https://twitter.com/SecAzar/status/1126096625607368704 …

During #SmallBusinessWeek, I urge the Administration to reflect on the dedicated work of these good people & stop threatening their livelihood in the trade war with China. Maine people should not be collateral damage in an escalating international dispute: https://www.npr.org/2019/05/06/720800559/u-s-businesses-face-challenges-as-trump-threatens-to-reignite-trade-war …

If you want to see a small business in action, during #SmallBusinessWeek, look no further than Maine’s lobster industry. It supports families up and down our coast, and helps bring billions of dollars into our state each year.

There’s a reason Joe’s principal had deemed him “an icon” of PCHS: he’s made his mark by creating and implementing new interdisciplinary programs to help students improve their analytical thinking and public speaking skills. Thanks for all you do for Maine’s students, Joe!

Maine's fisheries – particularly our lobster industry – are vital economic drivers of communities up and down our coast. I'm committed to working with them to make sure they have a voice in any new regulations that impact their livelihoods.

This week, I met with Commissioner Patrick Keliher and others from @MaineDMR to talk about an number of important issues facing Maine’s fishing communities – including the importance of balancing environmental regulations with the needs of Maine fishermen. pic.twitter.com/EGvsD4vV0R

Low-income Maine people shouldn’t be held to a higher standard than the wealthiest Americans – who, by the way owe an outsized share of unpaid taxes. Let’s fix this, by increasing the IRS’s funding so that the agency is able to hold the most egregious tax evaders accountable.

Recent data shows that the IRS disproportionately audits taxpayers in low-income Maine counties. Part of the reason why? Because the agency doesn’t have the resources it needs to take on the richest members of our society. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/03/sunday-review/tax-rich-irs.html?action=click&module=Opinion&pgtype=Homepage …

The start of spring is welcome news for Maine people, but the new season doesn’t only bring warmer weather – it also means the return of ticks and the health risks that come with them, particularly Lyme Disease. Learn how to protect yourself here: https://www.sunjournal.com/2019/04/30/tick-alert-may-is-lyme-disease-awareness-month/ …

After serving as part of the Women’s Army Corps in England and France, Dr. Endicott returned home, received her medical degree, and practiced as a family physician in Ogunquit for nearly 50 years. An incredible life of service to her community and her nation.
